list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: a heap of things laid or lying one on top of another.
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_en: he placed the books in a neat pile
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: Anh đặt những cuốn sách trong một đống gọn gàng

list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: a large imposing building or group of buildings.
a series of plates of dissimilar metals laid one on another alternately to produce an electric current.
a heavy beam or post driven vertically into the bed of a river, soft ground, etc., to support the foundations of a structure.
a triangular charge or ordinary formed by two lines meeting at an acute angle, usually pointing down from the top of the shield.
the soft projecting surface of a carpet or a fabric such as velvet or flannel, consisting of many small threads.
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_en: the thick pile of the new rugs
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: đống dày của tấm thảm mới

list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: place (things) one on top of another.
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_en: she piled all the groceries on the counter
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: Cô ấy chồng chất tất cả các cửa hàng tạp hóa trên quầy

list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: (of a group of people) get into or out of a vehicle or space in a disorganized manner.
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_en: ten of us piled into the minibus
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: Mười chúng ta chất đống vào minibus

list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: strengthen or support (a structure) with piles.
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_en: an earlier bridge may have been piled
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: Một cây cầu trước đó có thể đã được chất đống
